title: 3/23/23- Committee on Regulated Industries & Utilities
summary:
Overview:
This Georgia legislative committee session focused on House Bill 336, which dealt with refrigerants. There was discussion around the ongoing process at the Department of Community Affairs (DCA) to address the issue through amendments, potentially making the bill unnecessary. The committee ultimately decided to table the bill, allowing the DCA process to continue before potentially revisiting it in the next legislative session.

Key Actions:
- **HB 336**: Bill related to refrigerants, tabled to allow DCA process to continue

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
- None mentioned

Notable Moments:
- Testimony from Deidre Leclerc, an AI member and architect, who argued the bill was unnecessary given the DCA amendment process underway
- Discussion between legislators on communicating with the DCA and potentially revisiting the bill next session if needed

Votes:
- Motion to table HB 336 passed

Attendance:
- Quorum present, no attendance issues noted

Adjournment:
- No specific adjournment time provided, but this was noted as the committee's last meeting of the current session.
